TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was a co - owner and the head of a private enterprise “ Ekolog ” ( hereafter – the “ Ekolog ” company ) .

CARDINAL . DATE the “ Ekolog ” company was a party to several disputes before the commercial courts . The disputes concerned office premises acquired by the “ Ekolog ” company from a municipal enterprise . On DATE , CARDINAL May , DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG , by final judgments , ruled in favour of the “ LAW company 's adversaries .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG leased the office LOC to Mr B. In DATE bailiffs forced the “ LAW company to vacate the LOC and DATE Mr B. bought them .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and the “ NORP ” company lodged an action against ORG seeking invalidation of the lease of DATE . ORG of GPE received the statement of claim and judge PERSON was assigned to the case . The applicant subsequently submitted an amended statement of claim , asking ORG to invite PERSON to the proceedings in the capacity of a defendant . She sought compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . Following the applicant 's complaint to ORG about the excessive length of the proceedings in the case , on DATE the President of ORG informed the applicant that the first hearing was listed for DATE . That hearing was adjourned until DATE because ORG had not received a copy of the statement of claim .
CARDINAL . The following CARDINAL hearings fixed DATE and DATE were postponed owing to the absence of the ORG 's representative .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and the “ NORP ” company sued ORG for correction of registration logs in respect of the office premises . After ORG had received the statement of claim , judge PERSON was assigned to the case .

CARDINAL . The first hearing was fixed for DATE . As it appears from the list of events attached to the ORG 's memorandum , the next hearing was listed for DATE . On that date judge ORG accepted amendments to the applicant 's statement of claim .

CARDINAL . On DATE the “ NORP ” company lodged an action against ORG seeking the transfer of the lease rights in respect of the office LOC . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to confirm that she had lived in the disputed LOC . Both cases were received by ORG and assigned to judge I.
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to invalidate certain legal acts issued by ORG in respect of the office LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE judge ORG accepted the case file and fixed the first hearing for DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE judge ORG resigned and judge PERSON took over her cases . On DATE judge Y. joined the CARDINAL sets of the proceedings initiated by the applicant and the “ Ekolog ” company and listed the first hearing for DATE .

CARDINAL . Of the CARDINAL hearings fixed DATE and DATE , CARDINAL were adjourned because the defendants had defaulted and CARDINAL was postponed for the purpose of obtaining information from the commercial courts .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings because the case was within the subject - matter jurisdiction of a commercial court . That decision was quashed on DATE by ORG . The case was remitted to ORG for a fresh examination on the merits .
CARDINAL . On DATE judge Y. received the case file and listed the first hearing for DATE . That hearing was adjourned because the defendants did not attend .

CARDINAL . Of the QUANTITY hearings fixed DATE and CARDINAL May CARDINAL , CARDINAL hearings were adjourned owing to the defendants ' absence and CARDINAL hearings were postponed upon the parties ' requests for provision of additional evidence .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's claims . ORG held that in DATE and DATE the commercial courts had invalidated the sales - purchase agreement between the municipal enterprise and the “ LAW company in respect of the LOC . PERSON had lawfully acquired the title to the LOC in DATE and thus he was their legitimate owner . ORG also noted that the applicant had never lived in the LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment .
